body: Man @Lucent u make it sound like the  Granblue Fantasy world is fvcked up and real bad
hey, Jeanne here is better than the FGO has!
you stuck your dick in crazy, and this is what you get

Rage of Bahamut which was the predecessor of granblue and shadowverse was way darker (though the anime was somewhat less dark) God realm's full of assholes and power hungry hypocrites. Many of the Fallen angels (Lucifer, Olivia etc.)"fell"because alot opposed things like purging entire human towns or other immoral actions of the God's realm yet it was said fallen who were being blamed for the world's problems. Course there were also really messed up demons and humans making things even worse.
but damn son i got no issues on the storyline and the artwork son! so fine and it had some after taste of wanting for the sequel.
remember kids always be careful on hitting Jeanne Arc (alter) in F/GO translation. she maybe sexy and erotic but once she reach her limit you are dead.
I guess spoiler isn't working here

<spoiler>Oh and if you want to know why gran (or more like us as mc) is considered "this world's poison" that's because Jeanne was being tricked by that snake man. HAHAHAHAHA. No, actually it's because we have girl in blue(Lyria) and Vyrn, because both of them can summon Bahamut if they work together</spoiler>

@Lucent And you leveled up Jeanne and finally she turns back to light element but before that you have to solo snake man using Jeanne and killing some strong mobs then last is fighting mini Akasha. <--Have Jeanne Lvl 100
Sigh....
In Granblue Jeanne's home was destroyed and in her despair a demon convinced her it was Gran's doing. Pretty much its "do i fulfill my duty or do i give in to love" that sorta thing.
What the heck the ending was so sudden it didn't even count as a twist in my book
